gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦੀਪ ਦੀਪਤ ਪਤੰਗ ਲੋਟ ਪੋਤ ਹੋਤ ਕਬਹੂੰ ਕੈ ਜ੍ਵਾਰਾ ਮੈ ਪਰਤ ਜਰ ਜਾੲਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Deep Deepat Patang Lot Pot Hota , Kabahoon Kai Jvaaraa Mai Parat Jar Jaai Hai ?
translation: Just as a moth is enamored by the flame of a lamp, circles around it, and one day falls in the flame and burns himself.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਖਗ ਦਿਨਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਚੋਗ ਚੁਗਿ ਅਾਵੈ ੳੁਡਿ ਕਾਹੂ ਦਿਨ ਫਾਸੀ ਫਾਸੈ ਬਹੁਰ੍ਰਯੋ ਨ ਅਾੲਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Khag Dinaprati Chog Chougi Aavai Udi , Kaahoo Din Dhaasee Dhaasai Bahuryo N Aai Hai ?
translation: Just as a bird picks grains and worms the whole day and return to his nest as the sun sets, but some day, it is caught in the net of a bird catcher and does not return to its nest.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਅਲ ਕਮਲ ਕਮਲ ਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਖੋਜੈ ਨਿਤ ਕਬਹੂੰ ਕਮਲ ਦਲ ਸੰਪਟ ਸਮਾੲਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Al Kamal Kamal Prati Khojai Nita , Kabahoon Kamal Dal Sanpat Samaai Hai ?
translation: Just as a black bee keep searching and smelling elixir from various lotus flowers, but one day it is caught in the boxlike flower.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰਬਾਨੀ ਅਵਗਾਹਨ ਕਰਤ ਚਿਤ ਕਬਹੂੰ ਮਗਨ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਸਬਦ ੳੁਰਝਾੲਿ ਹੈ ॥੫੯੦॥
transliteration: Taisay Gurbaanee Avagaahan Karat Chita , Kabahoon Magan Hvai Sabad Urajhaai Hai ?590?
translation: Similarly, a seeker perpetually dives in Gurbani, but some day he becomes so engrossed in Gurbani that he is absorbed in Guru's words.  (590)
